content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: ✅ Approved the contribution. Comment: Clever and engaging crypto challenge, the instructions are clear, making it approachable while still satisfying to solve! Well Done!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun cryptography puzzle, and the clear description makes it easy enough for those unfamiliar with this cipher to understand.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I have enjoyed all of the puzzles in the Agent X series. Thank you!

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)

The Big message Test supplies "ADVANTAGE" as the guaranteed word, but it appears the output is truncated and the part presented does not have this word. The input is 1629 characters and output is only 900.
This puzzle is cool. Very creative!
This is so cool
nice one dude.

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)
Good puzzle, fun to crack

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: What a great pleasure to see a new puzzle about cryptography !

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)
bro, cool

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)
creative challenge!

* Please replace the unicode dash characters (–) in the Big Message test with simple hyphens (-).
I am not sure about other languages, but handling unicode characters in conjunction with character counting (900 limit) adds unnecessary complexity in C++. It is also good if you shorten the input text for this test, so it does not exceed 900 characters.

* The lengths of the keys in Test 1-2 and Validator 1-2 are very different. I suggest to change the key in Validator 1 to a shorter (3 char) key to match Test 1 and change the keys in Test 2 and Validator 2 to a longer one.

* The Big Message Validator contains words enclosed in quotation mark characters, but these characters are not listed as separator characters. It would be good if one of the tests would also contain such a word. It can be very frustrating if all the tests pass and one of the validator fails. 

* Two comma characters are misplaced within the quotations in the Big Message Validator:
"pj mwkxjwo xpvihrxhxvflag,"
"CID,"
They should be placed after the quotation mark.
Not a big deal, but it changes how the words are separated.
Je trouve la logique intéressent, je n'ai pas pu le résoudre mais je travaille dessus tout de même. Je te tiens au courant!
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

Got this error for validator1 but pass all other tests.
Found: SWEQSIBDJYC
Expected: EQSIBDJYCSW

Not sure if this is a bug...

Other than this, a very good and challenging puzzle!
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!
so good
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

Hi,

In test 5 I had to specifically manage the character "–" which is considered as having a length of 3 by the default function to get the string length. It's still solvable but I don't think it's worth the trouble of having to deal with special characters with this puzzle especially since there's only one of them.
How do you do this?!? All three puzzles you've created are Awesome! I'm looking forward to all the puzzles you've made becoming READY and Successfully submitted!!! Nice Work!
good

Goal
* Suggest to change "look for it" to "check it out" (for your information, look for = find).

* Please change "is Keyword Selection" to "Select a Keyword".

* Please add "with wrap-around when needed" after "Apply the shifts to each letter".

* Please change "And for multi word we continue to write the key where we are for example : The reaping keyword" to "When we repeat the keyword, we ignore any non-letter characters. For example, the pattern of the keyword {{ABC}} to apply to".

* Please change "conserve" to "conserves".

* Please add "Non-letter characters are kept unchanged."

* Please change "[[size]]" to "[[key_length]]".

* There isn't any list of [[N]] [[word]]. Please correct it.

* Please change "{{SP}}" to "{{space character}}".

Input
* Please change "guarantees" to "guaranteed".

* Please change "on" to "in".

Output
* Please change "encrypted" to "encrypting".

* Please change "char" to "characters".

Thanks.
I put this in medium difficulty does it look good ?

Thanks you for you comment. Creating this puzzle i face two issue, the first is that input are limited to 10000 character and output only 1000, do there is a way of fixing this ?

Also, i tried to add _ for read a variable name in stub generator but don't succeed, is this possible, just i don't know how to do ?
Thank you very much, it's a great pleasure. I'm not I'm still on holiday until the end of the week, so I'm trying to finish before going back to school.

Thanks for you feedback.
I don't see why the string lenght should be 3 instead of 1. What's more, it's not a word. But if you think it's better to remove it, there's no problem for me to do so.

Hum no, if you take the first char T and add four because of E you got X as given in the input.

If you got such an error it's really wierd that you pass all others

(1) sry for the error, didn't see that i made that mistake. I use python for generating test case and for the solution code so i didn't see this char. But fixed.

(2) Ok, I could change that to.

(3) Yes here cotation mark aren't world separator, you can check my solution code to see that i didn't use them but they should be ignore like number for example or ' like in didn't. So if removing them i also need to remove other thing. (Or just add some cotation mark in the big message)

(4) Yes not a big deal because there are space after cotation mark but updated
Yes, that's because coding game limit output up to 1000 char so i put in the output section to only show the first 900 character
Pardon my ignorance, maybe I'm missing something, but shouldn't the truncated test cases be fixed before approval?

Oops, I missed it! Thanks for clarification.
Very nice puzzle.
I'm sorry I can't see this output section you're talking about. Is the truncated text supposedly showing somewhere?

(1) It's not your fault. :) Most of the languages handle unicode characters seamlessly, but with C++ it would change the difficulty of the puzzle to Hard. :)

(3) I don't want you to remove the quotation marks. I just wanted to point out that they are somewhat special and they are present only in one of the validators. It would be better if they would be present in one of the tests as well, but it is not important. I can accept the puzzle this way as well.
After double check my code, I noticed I forget to handle number in the text. That makes the error.  Now everything looks good!
How many mission do you think it's good to do ? Originally I wanted to make 5. but because i have so many idea i want to make more. But I don't want to overdo it either

First off... it is a great pleasure to have a preview of your contributions!

Secondly, it depends on how many encoding/decoding ciphers or ideas you have in mind.

So far you have three ciphers:
- Caesar Cipher
- Vigenère Cipher
- (unknown to me) Cipher

They're all great looking! If you are going to make 5 in total go ahead.

If you wanted, you could make 5 puzzles for Agent X. Then make a few more for another Agent, say Agent Z... or something.

Either way, feel free to discuss with me. I will reply when I can.

Keep up the good work!
Code-Parser

I'm doing a new puzzle, the four square ciphers. But I've still got a few ideas, and I'd like to make an RSA out of it. But not long ago I came across a cipher with another ring (Gauss integers, a+ib where a and b are integers). It's a more complex version than the RSA, but there's nothing on the internet and I've had to read research articles that aren't necessarily understandable. If I understand correctly, maybe I'll make it be the final puzzle.
Do you know the name of it?
The cipher, I mean. I can try to look and help you.
It's very complicated, you can do a search on "rsa with gaussian integer" or "gaussian integer cryptography".
I have this link but don't start to read : http://csm.beirut.lau.edu.lb/~rharaty/pdf/2004%20-%202.pdf
Yeah limited stuff. Still looking.

Thank you too.

(1) No way to fix it - there is a character limit.

(2) No way to fix it - the stub generator has its own rules on variable names.

Input
* Please change "on the" to "in the", and "on upper case" to "in upper case".

Thanks again.
Thanks again, when I make mistakes in English like that I feel so bad
No worries! We all learn from our mistakes and get better and better.

I've taken a fresh look at the statement and have the following new comments:

Goal
* Near the end: Please change "Non-letter" to "non-letter".

* Near the end: Please change "By knowing" to "To do so you are given".

* Near the end: Please add "." after "in the message".

Thanks.
Thanks, updated
I've added "contains English letters only and" to the first constraint, to clarify that a word containing punctuation marks such as "THEY'RE" won't be a [[word]] in any test case.
